title: Ronan Farrow's mom, Mia, gets Halloween homage from #MeToo icon Rose McGowan
text:
USA TODAY

Halloween is almost here and Rose McGowan is using her costume to honor the actress behind a classic film portrayal.

The 46-year-old McGowan took to Twitter Wednesday to give fans a sneak peek into her transformation into Mia Farrow's character from the classic 1968 horror film, "Rosemary's Baby."

Farrow is the mother of journalist Ronan Farrow, whose coverage of disgraced film mogul Harvey Weinstein helped him earn a Pulitzer Prize. McGowan was one of Weinstein's first and loudest accusers.

"my Halloween costume is an homage to one if the greatest women ever @miafarrow," McGowan, wrote along with an image of her as Farrow's character in "Rosemary's Baby."

To complete the look, McGowan wielded a knife and rocked Farrow's signature short blond hair and long blue dress from the movie.

In 2017, Farrow's son published an investigative report in the New Yorker detailing multiple alleged instances of sexual misconduct perpetuated by Weinstein.

She says he raped her at the Sundance Film Festival in 1997. Her public acknowledgment two decades later helped fire up the #MeToo movement in October 2017. Hundreds of women have come forward since to accuse Weinstein and scores of other entertainment figures of sexual misconduct ranging from groping to rape.

Rose McGowan sues Harvey Weinstein, Lisa Bloom, more claiming 'diabolical' intimidation plot

In an October interview about his new book, "Catch and Kill," Ronan Farrow told USA TODAY he had multiple named accusers, including McGowan, and taped audio of Weinstein threatening model Ambra Gutierrez when he brought his investigation to NBC executives.

Ronan Farrow says NBC’s alleged cover-up of sexual misconduct is ‘bigger’ than Matt Lauer

But according to the journalist, executives continually poked holes in his reporting and delayed running the story, telling him it wasn't "newsworthy" and to "give it a rest" before killing it. (NBC News president Noah Oppenheim disputed Ronan Farrow's claims in a memo, writing that he had "no victims or witnesses on the record.")

Contributing: Maria Puente, Patrick Ryan
description: #MeToo advocate Rose McGowan gave fans a glimpse of her Ronan Farrow-related Halloween costume.
